SENT.plain: A 51-year-old male patient was diagnosed with Burkitt lymphoma 3 months after cardiac transplantation
The bone marrow karyotype was very complex, and to better define the complex karyotype we used the in situ suppression hybridization technique

Previously we interpreted this karyotype to be: 48,XY,t(2;8)(p11;q24), +der(2)t(2;8)(p11;q24),del(2)(q23), +7, +der(8)t(2;8)(p11;q24), +12, -13, -18, by G banding techniques, with a duplication of the t(2;8) derivatives
After in situ hybridization we changed to a: 48,XY,t(2;8)(p11;q24),t(2;18)(q23;q22), +7, +der(8)t(2;8)(p11;q24), +12, -13, which implies duplication of only one t(2;8) derivative
